title: Qualified Mortgage (QM) Rule
description: Establishes ability-to-repay requirements and defines qualified mortgages
content:
Qualified Mortgage (QM) Rule - Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB)

Effective Date: March 1, 2021

OVERVIEW:
The QM Rule establishes ability-to-repay requirements. Lenders must make a reasonable, good-faith determination that a borrower can repay the loan.

KEY REQUIREMENTS:

1. DTI THRESHOLD
Lenders must verify and document debt-to-income ratio. No fixed cap; price-based approach used. Loans must not exceed APR threshold for safe harbor.

2. INCOME VERIFICATION
Must verify income using third-party records:
- Tax returns
- W-2 forms
- Payroll statements
- Financial institution records

3. PROHIBITED LOAN FEATURES
QM loans cannot have:
- Negative amortization
- Interest-only payments
- Balloon payments
- Terms exceeding 30 years
- Points/fees exceeding 3%

RISK IMPLICATIONS:
- Compliant loans get safe harbor protection
- Non-compliant subject to borrower legal challenge

title: Fair Housing Act
description: Prohibits discrimination in housing-related transactions including mortgage lending
content:
Fair Housing Act - Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD)

Effective Date: April 11, 1968

OVERVIEW:
Prohibits discrimination in housing transactions. All lending decisions must be based solely on creditworthiness factors.

PROTECTED CLASSES:
Cannot discriminate based on:
- Race
- Color
- National origin
- Religion
- Sex
- Familial status
- Disability

PROHIBITED PRACTICES:
- Refusing mortgage loans based on protected characteristics
- Refusing lending information
- Different terms/conditions based on protected class
- Discriminating in property appraisal
- Redlining neighborhoods

UNDERWRITER GUIDANCE:
Focus only on creditworthiness factors: credit score, income, employment, DTI, LTV, payment history. Never consider protected characteristics.

VIOLATIONS:
Subject to civil penalties, lawsuits, regulatory action.
issuing_authority: Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD)

title: TILA-RESPA Integrated Disclosure (TRID)
description: Requires specific disclosures for residential mortgage transactions
content:
TILA-RESPA Integrated Disclosure (TRID) - CFPB

Effective Date: October 3, 2015

OVERVIEW:
Requires specific disclosures to help consumers understand loan terms.

LOAN ESTIMATE:
Provide within 3 business days of application:
- Loan terms
- Projected payments
- Closing costs
- Comparison information

CLOSING DISCLOSURE:
Provide at least 3 business days before closing:
- Final loan terms
- Final closing costs
- Transaction summaries

TIMING REQUIREMENTS:
- 3 days for Loan Estimate
- 3 days before closing for Closing Disclosure
- New 3-day wait if APR, product, or prepayment penalty changes

VIOLATIONS:
Extended rescission rights, regulatory penalties.

title: Home Mortgage Disclosure Act (HMDA)
description: Requires collection and reporting of mortgage lending data
content:
Home Mortgage Disclosure Act (HMDA) - CFPB

Effective Date: December 31, 1975

OVERVIEW:
Requires collection and reporting of mortgage data to identify discriminatory practices.

DATA COLLECTION:
Must collect and report:
- Applicant demographics
- Loan amount and type
- Property location
- Loan pricing
- Denial reasons
- Credit score used

REPORTING:
- Annual submission by March 1
- Loan/Application Register (LAR) format
- Submitted to CFPB
- Data publicly available

PURPOSE:
- Monitor fair lending compliance
- Identify discrimination patterns
- Inform community investment

VIOLATIONS:
Regulatory examination, civil money penalties.

title: Fannie Mae Selling Guide
description: Requirements for loans eligible for Fannie Mae purchase
content:
Fannie Mae Selling Guide - Federal National Mortgage Association

OVERVIEW:
Requirements for loans eligible for Fannie Mae purchase, providing lender liquidity.

CREDIT REQUIREMENTS:
- Minimum Credit Score: 620
- Maximum DTI: 45% (DU), 50% with compensating factors
- Maximum LTV: 97% primary residence

PROPERTY TYPES:
- Single-family residences
- 2-4 unit (owner-occupied)
- Condos (with approval)
- PUDs

DOCUMENTATION:
- Income per Desktop Underwriter findings
- Asset verification
- Employment verification
- Compliant appraisal

WAITING PERIODS:
- Bankruptcy Chapter 7: 4 years from discharge
- Foreclosure: 7 years
- Short Sale: 4 years
- Deed-in-lieu: 4 years

NON-COMPLIANCE:
Loans held in portfolio or sold at discount.
